item.title: Report E-2024010178
item.description:
Report E-2024010178

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics LSL experienced a battery acid release from a UN2794 2100-pound battery. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of battery acid released to a 20’ x 5’ area of the wooden trailer floor and a 20’ x 6’ area of the asphalt lot below due to the battery falling over as a result of improper loading. Oil dri was deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, the impacted pallet and PPE were then collected into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The battery was up righted and re-secured to a pallet for shipment on. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Report E-2024010231

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The dome lid on the KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC trailer was loose. This allowed approximately 2 gallons of hydrobromic acid to be released. ES&H Environmental responded and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2023120796
item.description:
Report X-2023120796

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: GEISMAR
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 5, 2023 at 1200 hrs., FRA Hazmat Inspector discovered what appeared to be product running down the sides of PNWX 703091 (Load / UN 3082 / Class 9 / PG III) at CN Geismar Yard. The liquid on the exterior of the railcar was observed coming from the manway. The inspector climbed the railcar and attempted to turn the manway cover bolts by hand but was unsuccessful. The FRA Inspector notified the Dangerous Goods Officer. The Dangerous Goods Officer made all notifications. CN Response Contractor responded and upon approaching the railcar observed moisture on the exterior of the railcar coming from the manway area. Upon further investigation, the manway gasket was found to be pinched which did not provide proper securement of the manway closure. The manway gasket was properly installed, and manway was secured. The exterior of the railcar was decontaminated and returned to Transportation.

Report E-2024010213

  • Description: Due to a defective dome lid on the trailer, approximately 1 gallon of Aminoethylethanolamine was able to be released from the trailer. E3 Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024010200
item.description:
Report E-2024010200

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-12
  • City: PLAQUEMINE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An employee of KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC opened a valve on the trailer. This allowed approximately 14,880 pounds of polyethylene glycol be released. The employee was not aware that the trailer was loaded with product and was attempting to prepare it for a wash. E3 Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
